timeline.bodyText:
You have a TAB character instead of spaces on the beginning of the line.
Would it be possible (and easy) to add a test that checks if there is TABs instead of spaces in the beginning of the lines in Java? I have done this misstake several times myself. I would like CI to catch these if possible. There are 1209 files in src folder and 3436 files in test folder with TABs. If you want, I could change these to spaces, if a test is added to CI to check that these doesn't come back.
timeline.author: danielb987

replies.bodyText:
You have a TAB character instead of spaces on the beginning of the line.

That should be fixed now.
I'll have to fix the editor settings on this machine.

Would it be possible (and easy) to add a test that checks if there is TABs instead of spaces in the beginning of the lines in Java? I have done this misstake several times myself. I would like CI to catch these if possible. There are 1209 files in src folder and 3436 files in test folder with TABs. If you want, I could change these to spaces, if a test is added to CI to check that these doesn't come back.

That's probably something we could do with checkstyle.  @rhwood @bobjacobsen thoughts?
replies.author: pabender

replies.bodyText:
A google search gives this:
FileTabCharacterCheck
https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/FileTabCharacterCheck.html
replies.author: danielb987

replies.bodyText:
Checkstyle FileTabCharacterCheck works fine.
master...danielb987:check_tabs
https://travis-ci.com/github/danielb987/JMRI/jobs/323268641
If this is desired, I can fix the java files and create a PR with this.
replies.author: danielb987

timeline.message: Put only freezeButton test on intermittent List
